page.title: 16Colemans Green.
page.content: Colemans Green is a small village.It has a Boarding Kennel for dogs a Public House and a few houses.There is an ancient monument which is the only remaining part of a cottage where John Bunyan is thought to have stayed.John Bunyan was a nonconformist preacher who was born in 1628.During the reign of Charles the 2nd he was imprisoned for 12 years for not attending church.While he was in prison he wrote the book called "The Pilgrims Progress".The public house is named after John Bunyan.The public house has a garden with an adventure playground for children.
